009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.circle.algebraic;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
014import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
015import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.SingularMatrixException;
016import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.SingularValueDecomposition;
017
018import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
019import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.PntUtils;
020
021/**
022 * This is an improved implementation of the Kåsa [1] circle fitting algorithm described in 
023 * [2, Sec. 5.2] (Eq. 5.12). It is based on the Moore-Penrose pseudo-inverse which is applied to the full data
024 * matrix (i.e, no 3x3 scatter matrix is mounted).
025 * See also [3, Sec. 11.1.2] and {@link CircleFitKasaA} for the original version.
026 * <p>
027 * This algorithm is assumed to be numerically more stable than solutions based on solving
028 * a 3x3 system. The pseudo-inverse is obtained by singular-value decomposition (SVD).
029 * However, the significant bias on points sampled from a small circle
030 * segment remains.
031 * Fits to exactly 3 (non-collinear) points are handled properly.
032 * No data centering (which should improve numerical stability) is used.
033 * </p>
034 * <p>
035 * [1] I. Kåsa. "A circle fitting procedure and its error analysis",
036 * <em>IEEE Transactions on Instrumentation and Measurement</em> <strong>25</strong>(1), 
037 * 8–14 (1976).
038 * <br>
039 * [2] N. Chernov. "Circular and Linear Regression: Fitting Circles and
040 * Lines by Least Squares". Monographs on Statistics and Applied Probability.
041 * Taylor &amp; Francis (2011).
042 * <br>
043 * [3] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
044 * </p>
045 * 
046 * @author WB
047 *
048 */
049public class CircleFitKasaC implements CircleFitAlgebraic {
050
051        private final double[] q;       // q = (B,C,D) circle parameters, A=1
052        
053        /**
054         * Constructor.
055         * The centroid of the sample points is used as the reference point.
056         * 
057         * @param points sample points
058         */
059        public CircleFitKasaC(Pnt2d[] points) {
060                this(points, null);
061        }
062
063        /**
064         * Constructor.
065         * The centroid of the sample points is used as the reference point for data
066         * centering if {@code null} is passed for {@code xref}.
067         * 
068         * @param points sample points
069         * @param xref reference point or {@code null}
070         */
071        public CircleFitKasaC(Pnt2d[] points, Pnt2d xref) {
072                this.q = fit(points, xref);
073        }
074        
075        @Override
076        public double[] getParameters() {
077                return q;
078        }
079        
080        private double[] fit(Pnt2d[] pts, Pnt2d xref) {
081                final int n = pts.length;
082                if (n < 3) {
083                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("at least 3 points are required");
084                }
085                
086                if (xref == null) {
087                        xref = PntUtils.centroid(pts);
088                }
089                final double xr = xref.getX();
090                final double yr = xref.getY();
091
092                
093                final double[] z = new double[n];
094                final double[][] Xa = new double[n][];
095                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
096                        final double x = pts[i].getX() - xr;
097                        final double y = pts[i].getY() - yr;
098                        Xa[i] = new double[] {x, y, 1};
099                        z[i] = -(sqr(x) + sqr(y));
100                }
101
102                RealMatrix X = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(Xa);
103                
104                RealMatrix Xi = null;
105                try {
106                        SingularValueDecomposition svd = new SingularValueDecomposition(X);
107                        Xi = svd.getSolver().getInverse();              // get (3,N) pseudoinverse of X
108                } catch (SingularMatrixException e) { }
109                
110                if (Xi == null) {
111                        return null;
112                }
113                else {
114                        double[] qq = Xi.operate(z);    // solution vector qq = X^-1 * z = (B, C, D)    
115                        // re-adjust for data centering
116                        RealMatrix M = CircleFitAlgebraic.getDecenteringMatrix(xr, yr);         
117                        return M.operate(new double[] {1, qq[0], qq[1], qq[2]});        // q = (A,B,C,D)
118                }
119        }
120
121}
